poem:
### Lines in the Sand

Cartographers of conflict,  
plotters of borders and bones,  
etch and redraw landscapes  
where lines whisper deceit.  
A state's proud posture  
bends to the whim of politics,  
as years stretch on—  
an eternity on paper,  
marked by ink and absence,  
Texas's veins redrawn,  
its pulse held in maps' embrace.
